==Chinese==

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|矢|口|t1=arrow|t2=mouth|c1=p|c2=s|ls=psc}}. This may also be an {{liushu|i|nocap=y}} – words coming out of people who know are like arrows being fired.

===Etymology===
The two pronunciations are cognate. The word is possibly of Sino-Tibetan origin, compare {{cog|lus|hria}}, {{m|lus|hriat||to know}}, {{cog|kac|chye||to know}}, {{cog|bo|རིག||to know}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).

====Definitions====
{{zh-hanzi}}

# to [[know]]; to [[understand]]; to [[comprehend]]
#* {{zh-x|「亢」 之 為{wéi} 言 也，知 進 而 不 知 退，知 存 而 不 知 亡，知 得 而 不 知 喪。其 唯 聖人 乎！知 進退存亡 而 不 失 其 正 者，其 唯 聖人 乎！|The force of that phrase - 'exceeding the proper limits' - indicates the '''knowing''' to advance but not to retire; to maintain but not to let perish to get but not to lose. He only is the sage who '''knows''' to advance and to retire, to maintain and to let perish; and that without ever acting incorrectly. Yes, he only is the sage!|CL|ref=Yijing}}
#* {{zh-x|子 曰：「由！誨 女{rǔ} 知{zhì} 之 乎？'''知''' 之 為{wéi} '''知''' 之，不 '''知''' 為{wéi} 不 '''知'''，是 知{zhì} 也。」|The Master said, "You, shall I teach you what knowledge is? When you '''know''' a thing, to hold that you '''know''' it; and when you do not '''know''' a thing, to allow that you do not '''know''' it - this is knowledge."|CL|ref=Analects}}
#* {{zh-x|知.人.知.面.不.知.心|One may '''know''' a person for a long time without '''understanding''' his true nature}}
#* {{zh-x|我 唔 知。|I don't '''know'''.|C-GZ}}
# {{†}} to cause to know; to [[tell]]; to [[inform]]
#: {{zh-x|通知|to inform}}
# {{†}} to [[administer]]; to [[take charge]] of
#* {{zh-x|知縣|governor of a county}}
#* {{zh-x|知客|receptionist at a ceremony}}
# {{†}} to [[distinguish]]
# {{†}} to [[appreciate]]
# {{†}} to be [[close]] friends; close friends
#: {{zh-x|知己|close friend}}
#* {{zh-x|知友|close friend}}
# {{†}} to [[perceive]]
# {{†}} to [[participate]] in; to have a hand in
# {{†}} [[knowledge]]
#: {{zh-x|求知|to seek knowledge}}
#* {{zh-x|無知|ignorant}}
